page.title: 08PAPERMAKING IN PENICUIK
page.content: Penicuik used to be one of the major papermaking towns in Britain but Dalmore mill near Auchendinny is the only mill left. The mill was started in 1837 by Mr. William Sommerville. At that time the mill used rags as its raw material because wood pulp and esparto grass had not been discovered. The mill started using esparto grass around 1865 and was a pioneer in this part of Scotland. After teething problems a successful operation was developed which carried on for nearly a hundred years. During World War 1 the mill carried on with one machine due to the shortage of materials and labour. During World War 2 this was repeated. Straw was used instead of esparto grass and a modest amount was produced. Today the output is about 8000 tonnes per year and 160 people are employed.
